content.text: Acceleration is a vector quantity
Underline the two vector quantities in the list below
energy
force
frequency
impulse
mass
refractive index
Calculate the speed of the car at time \(t = 3.0 \text{s}\)
At time \(t = 3.0 \text{s}\), it has travelled a distance of \(9.9 \text{m}\)
Calculate the average speed of the car during the first 3.0 s of the journey
On Fig. 1.1, sketch a distance-time graph for the first 3.0 s of the journey
A car accelerates uniformly from rest at \(2.2 \text{m} /\text{s}^2\) for \(3.0 \text{s}\)
State the word equation that defines _momentum_
the momentum of A before the collision,
momentum = .........
the velocity \(\nu\) of B after the collision

A metal block A, travelling in a straight line at \(4.0 \text{m/s}\) on a smooth surface, collides with a second metal block B which is at rest. Fig. 2.1 shows the two metal blocks A and B before and after the collision
The mass of A is \(3.2 \text{kg}\). The mass of B is \(1.6 \text{kg}\)
After the collision, the velocity of A is \(1.5 \text{m/s}\)
Calculate
In the collision that occurred in **(b)**, block A and block B are in contact for 0.050 s
Calculate the average force that is exerted on B during the collision
average force = .........
After the collision in **(b)**, the total kinetic energy of the two blocks is less than the kinetic energy of block A before the collision
Suggest **one** reason for this
Calculate the density of the block of wood
density = .........
The block is held just above the surface of a liquid of density \(0.88 \text{g} / \text{cm}^3\)
Predict and explain what happens when the block is released
A block of wood has a volume of \(210 \text{cm}^3\) and a mass of \(180 \text{g}\)
In the braking system of a car, the brake pedal rotates about a pivot when the pedal is pressed. Fig. 4.1 shows part of the braking system
(not to scale)

The driver exerts a force of \(200\mathrm{N}\) on the pedal at a distance \(22\mathrm{cm}\) from the pivot. As the pedal rotates about the pivot, a force is exerted on the piston and the pressure of the oil increases
The area of the piston in the cylinder is \(5.0 \times 10^{-4} \text{m}^2\) (0.00050 \(\text{m}^2\) )
Calculate the increase in the pressure of the oil
increase in pressure = .........
State and explain how the temperature of the white shirt differs from the temperature of the black shirt
Describe how two changes in the weather conditions could affect the rate at which the puddle dries
change 1
effect
change 2
effect
Explain, in terms of the water molecules, what happens as the puddle dries
The volume of water in the puddle is slowly decreasing

A footballer and a referee are discussing a puddle of water that has formed on the pitch. The footballer wears a white shirt whilst the referee wears a black shirt which, apart from its colour, is identical
Fig. 5.1 shows the two men looking at the puddle
The weather is bright and sunny
Explain how the particles of helium produce this pressure
State an equation that relates the volume of the helium to its pressure
Fig. 6.2 shows how the air pressure in the atmosphere changes with the height above ground level
1. Using Fig. 6.2, determine the pressure at ground level. Give the unit
Using Fig. 6.2, determine the height at which the volume of the helium in the balloon is twice the volume at ground level
As the balloon travels upwards through the atmosphere, the volume of the helium increases. The temperature of the helium remains constant
Fig. 6.1 shows a child releasing a balloon filled with helium
The pressure of the helium in the balloon keeps the balloon inflated
The frequency of the sound waves is \(6.0 \text{kHz}\)
Calculate the speed of the sound waves in water
speed of sound waves in water = .........
State a typical value for the speed of sound in air
speed of sound in air = .........
State and explain, for the sound produced by the loudspeaker, how the wavelength of the sound in air compares with the wavelength of the sound in water
Sound is a longitudinal wave
Explain what is meant by a longitudinal wave
State how the width of the gap affects the diffraction
State how the wavelength of the sound affects the diffraction
The sound emerges from the loudspeaker through a gap. The sound diffracts as it passes through the gap
A loudspeaker is built into the side of a swimming pool. The loudspeaker produces sound waves in the water of wavelength \(0.25 \text{m}\)
The light travels in a straight line from O to Q
Explain why the light does **not** change direction as it enters the glass block at P
The refractive index of the glass is 1.5
Calculate the angle between the normal and the ray in the air after the light emerges from the block at Q
The light travels in the glass to Q where it strikes the edge of the block at \(30^{\circ}\) to the normal. The light then emerges into the air
The direction of the light striking the curved surface of the glass block is changed. The angle between the ray and the normal at Q gradually increases from \(30^{\circ}\) to \(90^{\circ}\)
Describe what happens to the light that strikes the block at Q as this angle increases
Red light travelling in air strikes the curved surface of a semi-circular glass block at P. Fig. 8.1 shows the ray of light
Calculate the resistance of the lamp
resistance = .........
the p.d. between A and B,
the combined resistance of the parallel pair of identical resistors X and Y,
resistance = .........
the resistance of X
Determine
Resistor X is removed from the circuit in Fig 9.1
Explain why the lamp becomes dimmer
A 12 V battery is connected in series to a 24 W lamp and to a parallel pair of identical resistors X and Y. Fig. 9.1 is the circuit diagram
The 24 W lamp lights at normal brightness when the potential difference (p.d.) across it is 6.0 V
The lamp is at normal brightness
Explain why there is a voltage between the two terminals of coil Q
Explain why the core of the transformer is made of soft iron
Calculate the voltage between the two terminals of coil Q
voltage = .........
A heater is connected to coil Q. The current in the heater is 3.5A. The transformer is \(100\%\) efficient
Calculate the current in coil P
current = .........
A transformer is used to step up the voltage before electrical energy is transmitted over long distances
State and explain **one** economic effect of transmitting electrical energy at a high voltage
Fig. 10.1 shows a transformer that consists of two coils P and Q, and an iron core
There are 200 turns on coil P and 340 turns on coil Q
A 4.0 V a.c. power supply is connected to coil P
Suggest the purpose of the two lead plates
A magnetic field, directed into the page, is set up in the shaded region
State and explain what happens to the reading of the detector
Fig. 11.1 shows equipment that is used to investigate the effect of a magnetic field on the path of a beam of \(\gamma\) -rays
A radioactive source emits \(\gamma\) -rays. The \(\gamma\) -rays pass through two small holes in thick lead plates. Then the \(\gamma\) -rays pass through the shaded region and into the detector
State the relative ionising effects of \(\alpha\) -particles, \(\beta\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays. Suggest an explanation for the differences
